Title says it really, can you see your remaining fuel on the map screen? or is it only viewable on general view?

G.

I don't know of a method to do this on the overview map screen. I only open up my resources menu top right to guesstimate how much I have left before I need to jettison the stage. Definitely would love to know if this is possible too. Tired of switching back and forth.

Stock game for me, btw.
How does the "stage only" view work in the resource menu? Sometimes it shows nothing at all, even if I'm using the engines.

hmmmm

I do sometimes use the resource menu but its not as good as the fuel output in the scenic view. There must be a mod for this, if not I might have found a mod that I need to make.

G.

How does the "stage only" view work in the resource menu? Sometimes it shows nothing at all, even if I'm using the engines.

"Stage Only" shows the resources that are associated specifically with the current stage that's active. So say the current stage is that stack decoupler you just activated to drop your ascent stage into the ocean; that "stage" has no fuel or electricity associated with it, so it wouldn't show anything.

Basically, if you've got your fuel in the same part of the rocket as your engines and your engines are running, it should show the amount of fuel specifically left for them to use. It can be used for the same purpose as the graphical display on the staging control screen (and it should actually correlate exactly to it).
I dont think you can but i'm sure there might be a way or there will almost defiantly be a mod for it!
